Class UserAccountDataManager

java.lang.Object
plasystem_functions.UserAccountDataManager
public class UserAccountDataManager extends Object
Manages user account data in the PlaSystem database, providing functionality to add, load, update, delete, and validate user accounts. Maintains an in-memory list of user accounts synchronized with the database and tracks the logged-in user's username and role.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserAccountDataManager

      public UserAccountDataManager()
      Constructs a UserAccountDataManager, initializing an empty user accounts list and setting logged-in user details to null.

  • Method Details

    • getLoggedInUsername

      public String getLoggedInUsername()
      Gets the username of the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      The logged-in username, or null if no user is logged in.

    • getLoggedInRole

      public String getLoggedInRole()
      Gets the role of the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      The logged-in user's role, or null if no user is logged in.

    • setLoggedInUser

      public void setLoggedInUser(String username, String role)
      Sets the details of the currently logged-in user.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the logged-in user. May be null to clear the user.
      role - The role of the logged-in user. May be null to clear the user.

    • clearLoggedInUser

      public void clearLoggedInUser()
      Clears the details of the currently logged-in user, setting both username and role to null.

    • loadUserAccounts

      public void loadUserAccounts()
      Loads all user accounts from the UserAccount table into the in-memory list. Clears the existing list before loading to ensure synchronization with the database. Displays an error message if a database error occurs.

    • addUserAccount

      public boolean addUserAccount(String username, String password, String role)
      Adds a new user account to the UserAccount table. Validates inputs to ensure they meet database constraints (non-null, non-empty, valid role). Refreshes the in-memory user accounts list upon success. Displays appropriate error messages for invalid inputs or database errors (e.g., duplicate username).
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the new user. Must not be null or empty and must be unique.
      password - The password of the new user. Must not be null or empty.
      role - The role of the new user. Must be one of 'admin', 'cashier', 'store_manager', 'inventory_manager', or 'restocker'.
      Returns:
      true if the user account was added successfully, false otherwise.

    • deleteUserAccount

      public boolean deleteUserAccount(String username)
      Deletes a user account from the UserAccount table by username. Refreshes the in-memory user accounts list upon success. Displays an error message if the username does not exist or a database error occurs.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user account to delete. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      true if the user account was deleted successfully, false otherwise.

    • updateUserAccount

      public boolean updateUserAccount(String originalUsername, String newUsername, String newPassword, String newRole)
      Updates an existing user account in the UserAccount table, identified by the original username. Validates inputs to ensure they meet database constraints (non-null, non-empty, valid role). Refreshes the in-memory user accounts list upon success. Displays appropriate error messages for invalid inputs, non-existent usernames, or database errors (e.g., duplicate username).
      Parameters:
      originalUsername - The original username of the user account to update. Must not be null or empty.
      newUsername - The new username. Must not be null or empty and must be unique.
      newPassword - The new password. Must not be null or empty.
      newRole - The new role. Must be one of 'admin', 'cashier', 'store_manager', 'inventory_manager', or 'restocker'.
      Returns:
      true if the user account was updated successfully, false otherwise.

    • getUserAccounts

      public List<UserAccountData> getUserAccounts()
      Retrieves the in-memory list of all user accounts.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable view of the list of UserAccountData objects.

    • validateUserLogin

      public boolean validateUserLogin(String username, String password)
      Validates user login credentials by querying the UserAccount table. If credentials are valid, stores the logged-in user's username and role. Displays an error message if a database error occurs.
      Parameters:
      username - The username to validate. Must not be null.
      password - The password to validate. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      true if the credentials are valid and the user is logged in, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if username or password is null.
